responsibilities: Be part of hardware design team for acceleration cards, servers, and electrical validation for silicon
Work on schematic design for new acceleration cards
Be involved with AWS Servers testing
Participate in modeling and simulation of interconnects
Work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff
Adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions
Communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service
Follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies
qualifications: Schematic design and layout review of PCBs
x86 system design and microcontroller programming
Automation skills (Python, Perl, Shell, or Lua)
Experience with circuit boards, buck or linear regulators, transmission lines, high-speed design, transistors, operational amplifiers, low-speed interfaces, Linux, microcontrollers, and soldering
Familiarity with simulation and modeling tools such as Cadence Allegro, Cadence OrCAD, Altium Designer, Autodesk Eagle, KiCAD, and Spice simulation
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed are primarily focused on hardware design, electrical validation, and schematic design for acceleration cards and servers. The responsibilities include tasks such as working on schematic design, participating in modeling and simulation of interconnects, and testing AWS servers. The skills required include schematic design and layout review of PCBs, x86 system design, microcontroller programming, and familiarity with various simulation and modeling tools. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on hardware and electrical engineering rather than software or AI development.
